Battle Train is a turn-based action game co-developed by Terrible Posture Games and Nerd Ninjas and published by Bandai Namco Entertainment America.
Gameplay
The game mixes tactical rail dueling and deck-building strategy, setting in “the world's most popular” game-show for a full single player campaign. Players get to choose one of the contestants to play and complete to win against it's champion: President Conductor Aalvado, Duke of Destruction, Admiral of Diesel and Steam. Players customize their train with powerful upgrades and special abilities while building their deck of cards to aid their playstyle. When playing the game, they need to use their deck of cards around tracks, items, and abilities. They'll win some new prizes in various special events, each packed with some surprises along the way.
Gameshow
For the game-show, a random audience member is selected as a contestant.
Similar to the game Slay the Spire, the contestant makes their way through different challenges, layed out on a map.
The events on the map include battles, champion battles, minigames, shops, workshops (an opportunity to repair the train), story nodes, and random events.
Completing the challenges rewards the player not only with coins and cards to improve their deck, but also with trains parts which grant permanent upgrades. Except for hats and stickers, the player can only have one train part of each type though; the old part is swapped out when a new one is acquired.
Before facing the boss battle the contestant has to pass the Door of Worthiness.
The story nodes are animated cutscenes consisting of clips from a documentary about the game-show. The story progress is persistent and not reset at the end of the run. The unlocked cutscenes can be found and re-watched in the collection (reachable from the main menu).
The player is allowed to pick one of three random contestants for the run.
The contestants come with different cards added to the starting deck and usually have one starting train part.
Tutorial
When playing the game for the first time, the player starts with the character Cherlyl and is given a tutorial. The tutorial consists of a train battle against Hank Hannigan, the Presenter, Showhost, and Voice of the Network of the game-show.
After the tutorial, a run of the game show starts automatically, keeping Cherlyl as the contestant.
The tutorial can also be played again from the main menu later.
Daily Run
The daily run is a seeded run of the game-show with a leaderboard where players can compete for the highscore. In the daily run the game displays the time remaining time until the leaderboard is reset and a new seed of the day is generated.
The player only gets one attempt at each daily run, it cannot be played again after completing it.
In the daily run the player is only given one contestant instead of being allowed to pick one.
